author: Lauren Reich
text: "I've been to House of Que 5 times and I've had a wonderful experience every single time. I am not even a huge meat/BBQ eater but the food here is so good and so is the 512 sauce which I would eat just by itself if possible. The sides are all delicious but the corn pudding is above and beyond. I dream about it
column5: I think about it all the time
column6: I wish I was eating it right now. I don't even have photos of the food because I eat it all so quickly my brain doesn't have time to process the idea of taking a photo. I've also had a GREAT time at Dueling Pianos (I'm the nerd asking for them to play Hamilton.) I highly recommend stopping by!"

author: Joe Tomic
text: 'Not one to write reviews
column5: as I don‚Äôt think anyone‚Äôs opinion should deter you from having a good time. With that being said
column6: I have never been treated as poorly as I did on Saturday afternoon. It was my friends 27th birthday and we arrived at House of Que in great spirits. Unfortunately I could not say the same for some of the Saturday staff. As soon as we sat down
column7: the bartenders grew visibly upset and our entire group became uncomfortable (about 20 of us). We ordered food and drinks and did our best to enjoy our company! Over time
column8: we went from being unhappily served to completely overlooked. If the bar was busy
column9: thats completely understandable - it wasn‚Äôt. When we inquired if there was a problem
column10: one of the bartenders called my girlfriend a rude name that I don‚Äôt plan on repeating. Shortly after
column11: I was told we would no longer be served for the ‚Äúsafety of others.‚Äù No reason was provided. Rude servers
column13: and an overall poor experience. Hoboken has plenty of phenomenal places to spend a beautiful Saturday afternoon
column14: this is not one of them!'

author: Lindalee Battaglia
text: 'Love it.'

text: "The ambiance was amazing. There was karaoke

text: 'I have seen some negative comments on service but our waitress Vanessa
column5: absolutely amazing. I have been to some high end restaurants and her service tops it. She was on top of everything and when the chefs messed up our food she took it back and gave us the correct food no extra charge or argument
column6: even added a "im so sorry" to it. The food was decnet
column7: not some jawdropper and pricing is expensive but these are still very good prices for hoboken waterfront. Side note
column8: parking is difficult to find in hovoken but its not the restaurants fault. Great spot to go to if you are just in hoboken relaxing and want some food. Be careful for families because the music is very very loud. Overall decent food
column9: great experience
column10: and amazing service by Vanessa. Would recommend.'

author: Kenneth Price
text: 'I found this restaurant to be unremarkable. The service was fast and courteous but they forgot to communicate to the customer the most basic things. I ordered a special that comes with 2 sides. When I placed the order he forgot to take the time to ask about the side dishes. While I ordered appetizers
column5: I received the entrees almost immediately after getting the appetizers. The pulled pork that I ordered was bland and without seasoning. I had to take bbq sauce from another table to give it any taste.  My advice to the managers would be to retrain your wait staff and do not allow food to be served without any seasoning'

text: 'I was getting ready to order something for delivery and saw all the mixed reviews.üò¨ I cannot understand how one person gives one or two stars and another is 4 or five stars? Was it the time of day?\nWhen you work in a restaurant with  lots of different people and personalities including rude clients
column5: you have to maintain a smile and correct immediately no matter what. I used to work in a deli here in Hoboken and I dealt with all kinds of characters. Some think they are privileged and some are very humble and kind. I was able to handle bothüëç‚òï'

author: Edwin Cabrera
text: 'On Friday June 25th 2021 at approximately 3pm My friend and myself went to try this place out in Hoboken and spoke to the waiter ( white bearded male with a fohawk style hair) attended us
column5: and told us to sit down outside. I use the word ‚Äúattend‚Äù loosely
column6: but he brought us our waters and said he would be back shortly. Well 25 minutes passed and he never came to attend us so we decided to leave. No exaggeration because I used the time of parking meter app as reference. The restaurant was not busy at all
column7: had about 5 tables all whom their foods were already serve
column8: but it was obvious the waiter kept avoiding us on purpose. Why
column9: because Every time I‚Äôll attempt to make eye contact he would turn his back and do casual conversation with other tables who already order their food. It‚Äôs a shame because the menu looked appetizing and I was craving the House of Que burger
column10: but it was upsetting we got no service by any of the staff. It‚Äôs worth noting everyone outside was as being treated except us
column11: maybe because we were the only minorities in the restaurant? Prejudice? I‚Äôm sure it was not that‚Ä¶I just went to the restaurant that is right next door
column12: pricer; but at least they  treat everyone equally.'

text: "The views and location are the greatest asset to this spot. You can walk off your food after indulging in your favorite BBQ meals. I felt a little risky and selected the Sloppy Texan. Unfortunately

text: "Only reason I am giving this 2 stars is because our waitress was nice. Everything else about this dinner was terrible. Sangria pitcher was mostly ice
column5: came out to three full drinks
column6: tasted like Kool Aid. Beer tower came next
column7: the beer was stale. We ordered wings to start
column8: the wings weren't bad
column9: but the oversaturation of sauce made them bad. The wings weren't tossed in sauce
column10: they had sauce globbed all over the top... awful. Our entrees came next
column13: and 3 sides of mac and cheese and cornbread. Everything came out cold. It took forever to come out
column14: which is fine because the place was busy
column15: but this made me believe our food was just sitting on the counter and nobody came to get it so it was served to us cold. Ribs lacked flavor
column18: cornbread was also dry.\n\nNot sure what happened to this place
column19: but it has serious glaring issues. This is not good BBQ
column20: and I will most likely never be coming back."

author: Latanya Dunn
text: 'Well I can say probably won\'t return here
column5: VERY over priced. Before we even get to price our party was already turned off as we approached the podium to be seated we were not greeted warmly
column6: as we felt like what do you want
column7: later I was told the guy was a manager named Zeus that was covering the podium 5/1 late afternoon...as I was not in a mood to make this a race thing I proceeded and decided to see how this played out. One thing these establiments need to realize is you never know WHO is walking thru your doors...well today it was a YELPER & a Google Review Guru with over 2.5 MILLION views of my pic\'s etc. So after the rude approach upon seating us
column8: we were seated and not really feeling the seating we asked if we could change the young man said oh you have to ask the guy at the podium..after how we felt.. I refused and was annoyed as we asked you and you work there and I need you to go inquire for me as a customer. We moved.\nVanessa came and introduced herself she was nice and professional- Service was ok. Food was Super overpriced and we ordered these "48 hour wings" which were OK
column9: tasted like the same wings I make in my air fryer and 6 wings for 14.00? Air fryer wings?? The Cowgirl drink was nice. We ordered burgers and fries. Burger was good and flavorful. Our bill was 140.00.\n3 drinks
column11: & 6 wings & order or fries.\nThe liquor store and Five Guys may have been a cheaper option LOL  #YOLO'

author: Adam Knuckey
text: 'Don‚Äôt order meat if you go later at night.\n\nIt seems that once they start focusing on the drinking crowd
column5: the quality of the food goes way down. I ordered the brisket and the pork shoulder
column6: neither at all cheap. The brisket was cold
column7: incredibly dry
column8: and lacking in any flavor. I only ended up eating half of it despite not having eaten at all that day. The pork shoulder was ok
column9: but definitely not the quality I‚Äôd expect from a place calling itself the ‚Äúhouse of ‚Äòque‚Äù.\n\nHonestly I think they just took some leftovers out of the fridge and microwaved them for a few minutes. Only sauce I was given to go with it all was a small cup of ketchup
column10: but I assume that was for my onion rings
column11: which were very delicious and I‚Äôd absolutely recommend. Not sure if there‚Äôs normally a tasty sauce or two that I should have received to go with my meat.\n\nMusic was loud enough that
column13: my friends and I struggled to hear each other across the table
column14: and we were on the other side of the restaurant from the music booth. Catching up with an old friend I hadn‚Äôt seen in a while was a challenge
column15:
we both had to lean over the table and I had to scream directly into his ear for him to catch everything I was saying.

Old Fashioned I ordered was strong but not well balanced in flavor at all.

We had a reservation but didn‚Äôt get seated until about 30 minutes after that time.

Things are priced pretty highly for the small portions and low quality.

Very understaffed
column16: service is at best ok.\n\nNot going to come back
column17: there are definitely better places in Hoboken that would be higher on my list.'

author: Dianne randvere
text: 'The hostess on Saturday at 6 her name started with a S. Not going to reveal her full name but she was extremely rude and acted like she wanted to fight with my niece when my niece was checking in because we were supposed to have 2 tables of a party of 8 each. We got 2 tables party of 6 each. They separated our tables and when we tried to talk to each other by getting up to go to other table to celebrate my other nieces birthday they made us sit back at our tables.  We spent alot of money that night to be treated wrong especially when my one niece planned this and they said we can all be together.  However Kayla the waitress was amazing and the food was good except the chicken was dry. The mashed potatoes and mac and cheese were delicious. The ribs were delicious too. Although we had a bad experience
column5: I would still recommend them because of Kayla'

author: Digital Smooth
text: "Went in with high hopes. Great location and view. Service was nice
column5: fast and accurate. I heard about the pulled pork sandwich so i tried that. Nothing special - small portions
column6: more bun than i would have thought. If you can close the bun on the sandwich and not see the pork
column7: it's too small. Basic
column8: untoasted
column9: flavorless bun. The pork itself with the bbq sauce was okay but nothing to remember. The portion of fries was too big. Everyone ate about half their order (fries do not come with the sandwich). Surprisingly there was no pulled chicken.\nAlthough i didn't have any
column10: i heard the sangria was very good (designated driver). Our bbq chicken strips were basic breaded chicken strips slathered in a house bbq sauce - they should have been grilled. Nothing like spending $16 on an app for some frozen strips! The nachos were seemingly enjoyed by the table. Go for a drink and some nachos and enjoy the view.\nAs a big fan of bbq perhaps i expected more (which i did).\nWith so many options in Hoboken

author: Trenell Greene
text: 'Avoid this place at all cost. This was the worst place I have ever been to. Location is the only thing going for this place. The service was the worst I have ever experienced. Do not see Vanessa. The food took long and was not good I ended up just throwing it away. Drinks were horrible server kept talking to my guest and not me even though I was paying and made the reservations and all. I was excited to get bbq after moving here a month ago from down south. But this was a huge disappointment. I should have paid on my credit card so I could have disputed the charges. Do yourself a favor do not go there.'

author: Mr H.
text: "I showed up for the first time on a Friday night for country night
column5: not knowing what to expect. At first I was planning on just going alone for dinner and drinks
column6: but wasn't sure what their seating policy was for solo visitors (they never replied to my IG message) so I dragged a friend to go with me.  At the entrance
column7: we were greeted by several doormen at once. Not sure if they were all bouncers
column8: but kind of odd for a relatively quiet place. But
column9: we were quickly seated at a table near the bar area.\n\nFood was very overpriced
column10: but at least it was very good. Bud light drafts were on special for $4
column11: but server still charged our first beers at $6 each just 5 minutes prior to happy hour starting which was not cool
column12: but otherwise waitress was friendly and attentive.\n\nCountry music DJ was great and played both our song requests.  I noticed it started getting a little more busy by 7pm. There was a notice on their menu stating table time limit was 1.5 hrs
column13: but I guess since it wasn't too busy
column14: they didn't enforce it. I would definitely return."

author: The Critical J
text: "PROS: This place was definitely lit. TVs all over the place
column5: its clean
column6: has a young crowd in it
column7:
and the food is great with reasonable prices for its location. This place is right along the river and among other nice bars. The waitress was very nice and helpful to us as well.

CONS: There's no parking except for the street but of course thats hoboken which is why I haven't lowered their rating. Other than that they're pretty good.

OVERALL: If you do decide to come here I recommend the smoked wings. Unfortunately they're bone not boneless but its worth it. If you're in the area this is a better place to eat at compared to other places. I would make a reservation before trying to grab a seat as a walk-in"

author: Vickie Jones
text: 'It was cold outside.  Our nice waiter Ricky switched us to a table with a heater after our drinks.  Ricky was wonderful!!!The 48 hr smoked wings were good.  The corn pudding was good.  The Texas slaw had too much vinegar.  The view was beautiful but it was too cold for outdoor seating.  I would have enjoyed being inside to enjoy the live band
column5: but we were told that there was a private event going on when we arrived.  Later
column6: we learned that it was not a private event.  I should have been notified of this when I phoned about my Open Table reservation.  I notified the staff that we were celebrating a bday.  It was not acknowledged and nothing was offered to the bday celebrant.'

author: Christie O'Neill
text: "Two stars for the perfect location and ambience. Coming from Texas you know full well that if the meat were prepared on site you can smell it for miles. author: Vivek Bhatia
text: 'Very bad service. Had gone here for a dinner and ordered specifically "no meat nachos". We were served nachos with beef in it. It was quite dark where we were seated and therefore could not see the tiny bits. When we noticed something rubbery we called for the manager who confirmed it was beef. It was a very bad experience and careless attitude by the restaurant.'

author: Dana Salvatore
text: 'If I could give zero stars
column5: I would. This was our first time going out to eat since COVID. We love BBQ so we decided to give it a shot. We got there and waited 20 mins to be served. Got our drinks and then waited another 50 mins for APPETIZERS. The food arrived cold and tasteless. The wings were also disgusting. Go somewhere else. Additional negative points for college kids everywhere. Some girl was also throwing up in the toilet.'

author: Kensy
text: 'I completely forgot to write this review but this place has excellent customer service. The first time I went there was 1 years ago and I enjoyed it so much I decided to take my family out there once we all got a chance. When the time was appropriate for every we went. Walking in I expected the same friendly customer service which I didn‚Äôt receive
column5: (side note: is was not busy at all) then our host sat us down and told us that they take care of us. The table we sat down at was FILTHY!!! The bench was sticky and the table. So I decided to swap the bench for another one
column6: and all the workers watch me and our host came over and told me that she watched me move everything and try to clean up the table. That was very awkward. To continue with that night when I was served my meal was incorrect and what the gentle did was take it back and wipe off the food with his hands and give me back the plate. I was amazed but such horrible  service especially when I made everyone excited to walk in this restaurant. After I finish that meal I did not tip
column7: but everyone else in my family did. My reason for not tipping was because our waiter didn‚Äôt give us her name
column8: she had a nasty attitude and also never checked up on us
column9: and she blatantly watch me clean a table and bench that should of been clean. Now as we leave the restaurant we are taking pictures and the host comes out and helps us. As we‚Äôre taking photos we notice the waiter we had staring through the window sticking up her middle finger. Then as we walked away she walked out the restaurant and started to curse all of us out. Instead of any of us give back negative energy I contact the manger
column10: and regional manger. The manger of House Que name was Zues. I can‚Äôt remember the the regional at the moment (sorry man!!) however they both contacted me and invited us to comeback which we did but they were our waiters which was a huge surprise. Not only that they apologize to all of us individually. Then gave us a on house free meal and drinks on every single thing we did. I was not expecting it at all but what really made my night was that we told them to stay around and join us which they did and the negative experience we had before went away. The waiter that cursed us out ended up getting terminated from her position and they even explain that they have had a meeting with every single staff member to reassure the rules in a restaurant ‚Äúworld‚Äù. Overall the reason why I give it 5 stars is because of the great service and the food was more of a 3.8 -4.0 but the overall experiences were great. THANK YOU HOUSE OF QUE HOPEFULLY I CAN COME BACK WITH MY FAMILY AGAIN.'

author: Pretty Addiction
text: "This experience was horrible. They charged me for 2 drinks that were never ordered. When I tried to correct the bill the manager was reluctant & wouldn't let me talk to the waitress that took my order so we could resolve all the confusion .. they threatened to call the police because I refused to pay for something I never had. After 40 mins of going back n forth they finally corrected my bill. Never should you have to dine out & experience such as this. I will never return & I hope no one supports this establishment. Highway robbery"

author: Ruben Fernandez
text: "The cocktail are lousy
column5: the food is average and the sauces are just okay. Not recommend never to return. The only good thing about this place is the wonderful nyc skyline but that's not a good reason for another visit."

author: Ivelisse Diaz
text: 'We decided to eat here for our Labor Day date and it was phenomenal. The outside dining area is beautifully designed and comfortable. We ordered the brisket
column5: it was very tender
column6: and the sauce blended perfectly with the dish. We also recommend the corn pudding. It pairs wonderfully as a side. Overall
column7: everything was satisfying.'

author: Tom R. Garlick
text:
'Went to "The House of 'Que" this past Saturday.

Our server was "Gabby" and will definitely ask for her next time.

Gabby was very attentive without being intrusive.
She is a very good conversationalist with a maturity beyond her years.

Gabby should train servers as to how to engage with customers!

The smoked sausage and ribs were very good.  The brisket was very moist
column5: but had no bark/crust on my portion.  (see below)\n\nAfter the meal
column6: I asked to speak with a manager and spoke with "Chris
column7: the General Manager".\n\nI wanted him to hear how good their employee
column8: Gabby
column9: is and I described why.  I also mentioned that my portion of  brisket had no bark and asked if that is usual.  Chris said no it is not and that next time to mention to the server that I like the bark and/or would like some of the burnt ends!\n\nChis is very personable
column10: as is Gabby!\n\nI hope the owners of House of \'Que read this review
column11: about Chris and especially about Gabby!\n\nBest regards

author: David Reagan
text: "Great service. Great for delivery. Solid food. Best BBQ I've had in Hoboken."

author: Edward L
text: 'Come here throughout the years. Love the pork belly. Good view of the skyline too. Outdoor dining for COVID and pretty romantic with the SO so good place for date night.'

author: Christopher Angelucci
text: 'Server and staff were excellent.  Food was served quickly. Nachos excellent.  Pulled pork  tasted great. Wonderful location very near the river.'

author: DAVID LOFREDDO
text: "Pretty good BBQ in Hoboken
column5: little pricy but that's what you get on the water"

author: Joshua Ingersoll
text: 'Seated as quickly as possible on a busy night. Food was good
column5: drinks served were strong.'

author: Barry Lass
text: 'Nice location and good beer selection. Food was ok. Pulled pork sandwich was a little dry.'

author: Randall Rivera
text: "Beautiful View Great Waiter's But Food Was Very Dry Drinks Tasted like water."

author: JohnMichael Sabatino
text: 'Great barbecue food. Great service. Food came VERY quick. Great view by the Hudson'

author: Alyssa Eve
text: 'The food is great !!! The curly fries are bomb . I had the pulled pork sandwich added jalape√±os and spicy bbq wings. Wings are crispy and saucy.'

author: Michael Martin
text: 'Ribs are awesome!'

author: AllAhead Full
text: 'Great
column5: reliable BBQ with awesome outdoor seating.'

author: Lesley Soto
text: 'So as me and my girlfriends were finishing up our meal
column5: we got interrupted by one of the workers who wore a black hat. There was an ice cream truck that was parking to give out ice cream
column6: where the worker started to yell at him telling him to go up the block. He wasn‚Äôt bothering anybody and it was very unnecessary and rude for him as well as the customers outside eating. Food and service were good
column7: although some of the meals were a little dry. But the way the worker handled the situation was very uncalled for and my girlfriends all agreed with the way he handled it.'

author: R Scott
text: 'The food there was very good. Ordered the ribs and brisket and they were both on point. Brisket had a nice smoke ring and was very juicy. Ribs were done well too with just the right amount of sauce.\nThe sides were just as good. I strongly recommend that you get the corn pudding and the sweet potatoes as sides.\nWas pleasantly surprised with the whole experience. Staff was excellent. Will be back.'

author: Rex Christian
text: 'Good service but the bbq was meh
column5: KFC tastes better.  but nice spot to sit and have a drink. Staff was friendly and attentive. Would go back but not for the food.'

author: Stephanie Cwynar
text: 'As someone who lived in Austin
column5: I felt the bbq and vibe was a little off. The food is overpriced and they don‚Äôt even serve Lonestar
column6: the national beer of Texas!'

author: Dave Reed
text: 'Service was slow waitresses  kept talking to her friends. An food was a 5 out of ten. View  for fireworks was awesome.'

author: Alexia Edwards
text: 'place: casual eatery with good menu options (both food & alc. beverages); outdoor hi-top seating is available for solo dining. nice staff
column5: quick service.\nfood & drink: the que‚Äôd rita was worth the money
column6: especially considering the generous portion and the bbq seasoning on the rim was surprisingly delicious. the brisket (chopped) sandwich was amazing
column7: beef was cooked perfectly.\nfinal note: overall would definitely recommend this place.'

author: George Baladi
text: "Went in for a table and said its a 20 minute wait. After 20 minutes we were informed they were closing and couldn't be seated."

author: Kibirrah Webb
text: 'Really good food! Great waitress
column5: will definitely go back!'

author: Eric Sposato
text: 'Great food. Brunch here is pretty epic!'

author: Tarrick Nicholson
text: 'nice üëå'

author: William Crawford
text: 'Great food. Great service.  The plating and presentation looked a little prison lunch
column5: but it was good and the lunch specials are a great price.  I will totally come back again.'

author: Maria Williams
text: 'I enjoyed this place good BBQ'

author: Theresa Aslin
text: "I didn't like my date
column5: and it's not a great date spot (too loud
column6: you can't hear each other talk very easily) so it cast a damper on this night out
column7: but I can't wait to come back here and try this place with some friends.The music was lively
column8: the food was delicious and the crowd was friendly. We found a seat a the bar around 9pm
column9: which was a bit late for dinner
column10: but they let us eat there
column11: at the bar. Next time I'll come early and get a table. I'm sure the place is really fun in the summer too
column12: because you can walk along the Hudson river before you head home. I like that this is something different from the standard bar scene."

author: Joan Lazar
text: 'Purely a review of the food
column5: as I ordered take out and did not dine in (quarantine life).\n\nBackstory: I worked at one of the best barbecue places in the states
column6: I tasted a LOT Of barbecue from neighboring restaurants in NYC and Brooklyn. I have tasted incredible barbecue and i\'ve tasted mediocre bbq.\n\nWell
column7: this was mediocre. The brisket was hard
column8: chewy
column9: lacked flavor
column10: and appeared grossly overdone. The rub was minimal
column11: it didn\'t have that "supple fall off the imaginary bone" texture. I have a feeling it wasn\'t even cooked in a smoker
column13: it definitely was rushed at a far too high temp. I was not impressed. It was almost rubbery.\n\nThe mac and cheese was acceptable
column14:
but not great.

The brisket chili had... giant chunks of hard brisket in it. I was hoping they'd be shredded. Not impressed.

The sweet potato fries were okay
column15: nothing impressive there.\n\nThe manager was a little stand-off-ish
column17: we\'re going through some tough times.\n\nOverrall

author: Angel Nava
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent

(Original)
Excelente'

author: Abi Smith
text: 'Awesome brisket and fries.'

author: ZiggyBFishing CustomRods
text: 'Great food'

author: Jake Raynor
text: "Everything is great about the place except for the manager.. The food
column5: drinks
column6: environment
column7: and service is great. The manager who is about 5 foot 6
column8: very short hair
column9: and wears glasses is rude to customers and quite frankly childish. I spent my entire time there watching him arguing with customers and then complain about them to his staff behind the bar..When I asked who he was
column10: our waitress said the manager. Poor wait-staff and kitchen team. I will call ahead and see if he is working before I go back. If he isn't

author: Sidharth Ghoshal
text: 'It‚Äôs a bbq place so it hit the spot
column5: but not ideal. I found the beef brisket to be a bit chewy and the smoked sausage left something to be desired. On the plus the Carolina sauce was quite good!'

author: U. R.
text: "Bbq is  pretty decent for NYC area. It can't shake a stick at legitimate southern bbq places in Texas
column5: KC
column6: Georgia or Memphis
column7: but still good.  Music was fun
column8: you need at least $20 tip to get your music played but it's raucous and lively atmosphere.  Regular Margaritas were very good.  Do not try this putrid concoction called a Que Margarita.  It was the most disgusting cocktail I ever drank. Service was very good
column9: although the waitress comes around less once the music starts. Aside from that awful Que Margarita
column10: I would definitely go back to this place."

author: WILLIAM AVAL
text: 'Very good place
column5: delicious smoked pork ribs.'

author: Sanya Parkash
text: 'Tried multiple items on the menu
column5: all were phenomenal especially the chipotle BBQ wings. Servers were also very nice and good atmosphere.'

author: Hersey Gas
text: 'Was there this weekend for dinner
column5: this looks like a drinking place.  The brisket I ordered was tough
column6: and the chicken was dry; very disappointing.  Will not be going back.'

author: Arieverson Miguel
text:
"(Translated by Google) Great restaurant with a beautiful view. Kaitlyn's service was excellent.
I recommend smoked wings and Ribs.

(Original)
√ìtimo restaurante com uma bela vista. O atendimento da Kaitlyn foi excelente.
Recomendo smoked wings e a Ribs."

author: kmason
text: 'Recommend. Real Texas bbq on the Hudson. Ownership is from Austin
column5: TX. Always fun and a great place to watch big sports events. Good for families
column6: casual date night
column7: and the best skyline views of NYC.'

author: Ace Yim
text: "Good food
column5: good pricing
column6: and also good customer service. As long as you know your limits you'll easily go under $100 for 3/4 people."

author: Con Dios Al frente
text: 'Recommend the pulled pork sandwich'

author: Debbie Francis
text: 'Simply put DELICIOUS! This was my 3rd visit
column5: everything we ordered was very tasty. The wings are a must have'

author: Kevin Rozzi
text: "Great atmosphere but it ain't cheap to drink anything other than the beer specials. Tuesday trivia night and dueling pianos Saturday night are best nights."

author: James Rabito
text: 'Great BBQ'

author: First Last
text: 'Not cheap
column5: but usually worth it.'

author: Lucia Meira
text:
'(Translated by Google) I recommend I loved it!

(Original)
Eu recomendo adorei!'

author: Just Love
text: 'I work at the place and they are good people.'

author: David Schwen
text: 'I was really hoping for a good experience here. Read some good reviews and had some awful food. The bun on my pulled pork was soggy and wet
column5: like they just pulled it out of the freezer. Service wasn‚Äôt great either. Hard pass.'

author: Bob Hills
text: 'Food was just so so. Ribs were a bit dry. Coal slaw a bit bland.'

author: Jameson Roberts
text: 'The meat is flavorful
column5: warm atmosphere with live music'

author: Nicholas White
text: 'Awesome place to visit
column5: good food.'

author: Jason F
text: 'Great vibes and awesome location. Solid place to hang out for a few drinks. It can get pretty lively during peak times. BBQ is some of the best in town as well. Food and rink prices are a bit high but you pay for the view.'

author: Holly S
text: 'The food is amazing and the atmosphere is nice as well! There is a lot of space
column5: perfect for parties!'

author: Kyle Lukas
text: 'Good BBQ and the dueling pianos are entertaining. Nice views in the spring/summer.'

author: Cynthia Miranda
text: 'Pork belly
column5: wings
column6: and corn pudding are to die for! Saturday nights are really fun
column7: too!'

author: Andy Belov
text: "Had a magnificent New Years night there. People were singing and dancing with the piano players. It was like a village party. Unforgettable. We'll be coming back. The only notice is that if you didn't know and reserve the seats
column5: you had to stand all night. I called 2 times and they didn't tell me how to make sure that we get a table. But the staff was super friendly. Good place overall."

author: Yung
text: "Wow. Amazing food. The dino rib may look expensive but it's worth it. Best rib I've ever had. Will fill you up."

author: Darshan Choudhary
text: 'Nice ambience'

author: Phillip Blount
text: 'I just enjoy their dishes. I always get fantastic customer service here. The place is neat and the workers are always friendly. I highly recommend this place.'

author: daniel yong
text: 'Pricey'

author: Brittany Linton
text: 'Great food! Quesadilla and whatever sauce they give you is amazing'

author: Stephanie Faircloth
text: 'The collard greens are to die for!'

author: Warren McLeod
text:
'(Translated by Google) Crash!

(Original)
Karoki!'

author: Kimberly Delbrune
text: 'The food was good and the Texas sangria was great!  The prices were pretty high'

author: Nick LaMendola
text: 'Saturday night pianos are fun. Younger crowd singing along with piano classics that came out way before they were born like they own them. Beer list is pretty standard.'

author: karen luna
text: 'Nice place
column5: a lot of people
column6: familiar place and great food'

author: Sym Cardnel
text: "Foods ok. Need to clean up the outside  (windows
column5: dangling wires
column6: etc) to show some 'concern' as I'm thinking kitchens similar."

author: Jascha Schramm
text: 'I would give this zero stars if I could. Walk in and no one is at hostess podium. As my girlfriend and I stand there for a solid 3 minutes multiple staff members pass by not even acknowledging us. Finally someone from the kitchen approaches and asks if we needed a table and sits up and grabs menus. Server comes over takes our order and disappears. Food is brought out and was never checked in again. Saw server pass multiple times but never as if we needed anything or if we were ready for the check
column5: had to flag him down to ask for it. Place was not very full and saw several groups of staff hanging out talking so don‚Äôt understand the lack of attentiveness to the customers. Promptly paid check and left and will not be returning.'

author: Bob V
text: 'Great food but could not get our food out of the kitchen
column5: we ordered a big variety. The staff & service was good. Food was terrific. The manager took a few things off the bill as compensation for the kitchen not getting our food all out.\nIf we are back in Hoboken we will definitely consider going back!'

author: Ryan
text: 'I was excited to leave a 5 star review on open table
column5: but they cancelled my reservation 3 hours after we left - so 1 star on Google instead.'

author: Alexa Ray
text: 'Good food! Friendly staff and great vibe'

author: Angel ‚ÄúAngel‚Äù
text: 'First of all
column5: service was the worst
column6:
our server only showed up when we were seated and to bring the check. The busboy took care of us thankfully and he seemed to care about us having a good dinner

Pulled pork was DRY. How can you make such a fatty meat so dry is beyond me (hint: microwave) but not having a beer to wash it down was even worse. The server never gave us a chance to order a second one

Location is great but there is a reason why the place was absolutely empty at dinner time'

author: Jay W
text: 'Good food
column5: nice crowd
column6: friendly wait staff!'

author: Robert Hunter
text: 'awesome BBQ! definitely a must try...'

author: Dan healy
text: 'Really good BBQ. Good outdoor seating. Great menue. A little pricey though.'

author: Fran Gonzales
text:
'(Translated by Google) Marvelous

(Original)
Maravilloso'

author: jeff pearce
text: 'I ordered the brisket sandwich and it was the best I had in the longest time. Onion rings were good and plentiful. Apple cider was delicious'

author: Jonathan Bennett
text: 'Food was great
column5: service was exceptional'

author: Michael Blair
text: 'Kaitlyn was GREAT. Wonderful service and a fun personality. Great food and people! Definitely a favorite!! Great burgers and ribs!!'

author: Mansi Gandhi
text: 'Awesome bar with NYC skyline view üëåüòç'

author: rahul sawhney
text: "I lived in texas for 10 years. Moved out to the east coast to be closer to family
column5: but anytime I'm in Hoboken and have a craving for BBQ.  House of Que does it right.  Very great customer service( Wait staff
column6: bartenders  and host staff.) Food Is AMAZING."

author: Anuj Mittal
text: 'Great sports bar full of energy specially on weekend evenings with amazing view of the Hudson and Manhattan skyline. Had jalapeno poppers which was full of flavor but Mac and cheese was bad and tasted like Kraft Mac and cheese'

author: Jed Lynch
text: "$9 for collard greens
column5: but it's only place in Hoboken that sells them.  Anyone who says that is legit barbeque is full of $hit.  You have to go to South for real BBQ.  Here you're basically getting your standard bar food + Mac & cheese and collard greens."

author: Josena
text: 'Amazing food.'

author: Danny Balgley
text: 'Very good brisket and ribs. Not too crowded on a Sat night with live music and delicious housemate BBQ sauce.'

author: vincent & cathy puente
text: 'Well we were looking forward to it
column5: but was let down by the over cooked ribs and the tasteless Brisket
column6: chicken wings were nothing to brag about. But on the positive side awsome great Collard Greens and corn pudding . Great service.'

author: Shilpa B K
text: 'The wings were absolutely delicious and the grilled chicken sandwich was light and curly fries delicious. Must try!'

author: Mauro Briceno
text: 'One of my favorite places in Hoboken
column5: BBQ wings
column6: Texas brisket
column7: bbq chicken
column8: bbq Ribs
column9: and delicious corn bread. Great drinks
column11: tons of TV‚Äôs screens to watch any games and with city view. I‚Äôm still trying to find something megabits about this place.'

author: Aeshna Gupta
text: 'Amazing food
column5: nice place'

author: S I
text: 'Food was good until 3 mice came out to join the part. I ran out of there so quick.'

author: Rick Nieradka
text: 'Brisket was awesome so were the  wings'

author: Tim L
text: 'Just had a drink here. Nice place to stop and enjoy the outdoors in Hoboken.'

author: Jordan Urbaczek
text: 'Great BBQ options. Had the Pulled Pork sandwich lunch special with bean salad. Delicious. Tasty sauce and slaw in the sandwich. Also
column5: had a $3 draft Bud Light. Cheappp'

author: Eleni Lazarides
text: 'Came for Sunday Football. The food was subpar. The wings were pretty good but did not make up for everything else being so below average. Service also not great. Would not go back here.'

author: Matt Meyer
text: 'Very bland food not good'

author: reshma srinivas
text: "Went there a few weeks ago for weekend brunch
column5: their were hardly any waiters and no one bothered checking on us / catering. Being a vegetarian
column6: it's tough. But I was taken aback that the veggie burrito that me and my friend ordered had a piece of meat in it !\n\nWhen we informed the waiter
column7: he said sorry and to just take off the piece of meat and eat the rest.\nIt was unacceptable that they could do this. I would never return to this place again."

author: Nan Ya
text: 'Dissent food
column5: terrible customer service. Gave it a second try
column6: entree nave came out. Just asked for bill and left. Luck of attention and it wasn‚Äôt even hat busy. Disappointing!'

author: Deanna Catarino
text: 'Pull Pork Sandwich was amazing !'

author: Alastair Arthur
text: "We've come twice for brunch
column5: sat out in the (very welcome) shade by the Hudson. Very good food
column6: friendly staff
column7: beautiful surroundings and live music."

author: Paola Aranda
text: "Bad waiter  doesn't care about the people only taking with the other waiter  .üëéü§¨"

author: Dori Weathersbee
text: 'The food was delicious!'

author: Rory Palmer
text: 'Food was awesome'

author: Irina Limaico
text: 'Great place. Staff is awesome!'

author: carly d
text: 'Expected way more for the price and location. Meat was tough and dry. Service was terrible and the place was empty'

author: Eduardo Rodriguez
text: 'The sign in their door said they close at midnight on Mondays.  We called before we went there and the person that answered the phone said that they were open until midnigh. We got there at 10:30 PM and the place was closed.'

author: Stephen Harris
text: "My girlfriend and I went on a Friday around 6:30pm.  We both ordered sandwiches; I had the pulled pork.  On both the meat was barely warm
column5: tending towards cold.  I ordered a Stella to drink
column6:
but got something different.  When I sent it back the waitress never replaced it until I complained and then she gave me another drink that wasn't Stella.

The next day my girlfriend had a stomach upset; we can only presume it was due to the almost cold meat.

Definitely won't go back here!"

author: Marc Carrillo
text: 'I moved to the States 4 months ago. I love Hoboken waterfront and the bars and restaurants there. House of que has a good quality for an affordable price. Would definitely recommend this place!'

author: Brandon Bell
text: "The food wasn't bad but the best thing we had there were the wings. Drinks were also okay."

author: Joe C
text: 'I am in awe that this place has gotten above 4 stars for their food. Please people
column5: expand your horizons and venture to Texas
column6: NC
column7: etc. to try real barbecue! Dueling pianos and the drinks are definitely the highlight of this place.\n\nAs far as the food
column8: the ribs and brisket had my stomach in knots
column9: and I have been here multiple times. Be prepared the next morning...\n\nI think they should consider calling the restaurant something else
column10: because the "\'cue" is misleading for what barbecue should taste like'

author: Victoria Gelmi
text: 'LOVE dueling piano night!'
